meanings.definition: To assign a new date to something.
meanings.sent1: I need to redate the meeting to next week.
meanings.sent2: She had to redate the deadline for the project.
meanings.sent3: Let's redate the party to a day when everyone can come.
meanings.sent4: The event planner had to redate the wedding due to bad weather.
meanings.sent5: It's important to redate the appointment if you can't make it on time.

meanings.definition: To go on a date with someone again.
meanings.sent1: They decided to redate after a long time apart.
meanings.sent2: He asked her to redate him for a romantic dinner.
meanings.sent3: I never thought I would redate my high school crush.
meanings.sent4: After their breakup, they both agreed to redate and see how things go.
meanings.sent5: She was excited to redate her first love and see if the spark was still there.
